ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] jmxclient documentation or wrapper?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Robert, The output at each level kinda lets you know what you can do. For example: $ java -jar

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] jmxclient documentation or wrapper?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=325624130; y=N1-xcG9DEO5LcqodG1oqPFgaBMH63kSM0GQDputqe3cN5Q4

Hello Robert,

The output at each level kinda lets you know what you can do. For example:

$ java -jar /home/archiveit/bin/heritrix/bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar 
JMX_USER:JMX_PASSWORD localhost:8849
02/19/2008 22:06:29 +0000 org.archive.jmx.Client
java.lang:name=PS Survivor Space,type=MemoryPool
[...]
org.archive.crawler:host=localhost,jmxport=8849,mother=h1203120532639,name=194-20080216000911438,type=CrawlService.Job
[...]

You can take any of the output entries and add it to the end of the last 
command to dig deeper:

$ java -jar /home/archiveit/bin/heritrix/bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar 
JMX_USER:JMX_PASSWORD localhost:8849 
org.archive.crawler:host=localhost,jmxport=8849,mother=h1203120532639,name=194-20080216000911438,type=CrawlService.Job
02/19/2008 22:08:41 +0000 org.archive.jmx.Client
Attributes:
  Name: Crawl job name (type=java.lang.String)
  Status: Short basic status message (type=java.lang.String)
  FrontierShortReport: Short frontier report (type=java.lang.String)
[...]
Operations:
[...]
  getDatabaseNames: Get the names of databases in the environment.
   Parameters 0, return type=java.lang.String
  getDatabaseStats: Get database statistics.
   Parameters 3, return type=java.lang.String
    name=clear type=java.lang.Boolean If true, reset statistics after reading.
    name=fast type=java.lang.Boolean If true, only return statistics which 
do not require expensive computation.
    name=name type=java.lang.String Database name
[...]

Then you can do it again, e.g. with Status:

$ java -jar /home/archiveit/bin/heritrix/bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar 
JMX_USER:JMX_PASSWORD localhost:8849 
org.archive.crawler:host=localhost,jmxport=8849,mother=h1203120532639,name=194-20080216000911438,type=CrawlService.Job 
Status
02/19/2008 22:13:30 +0000 org.archive.jmx.Client Status: RUNNING

Operations work similarly. The format for passing parameters is 
OPERATION=PARAM1,PARAM2,...

$ java -jar /home/archiveit/bin/heritrix/bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar 
JMX_USER:JMX_PASSWORD localhost:8849 
org.archive.crawler:host=localhost,jmxport=8849,mother=h1203120532639,name=194-20080216000911438,type=CrawlService.Job 
getDatabaseNames
02/19/2008 23:12:20 +0000 org.archive.jmx.Client getDatabaseNames: 
[allqueues, alreadySeenUrl, classCatalog, hosts, hostsBytes, 
hostsDistribution, hostsLastFinished, http_cookies, inactiveQueues, pending, 
processedSeedsRecords, retiredQueues, servers, sourceHostDistribution]

$ java -jar /home/archiveit/bin/heritrix/bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar 
JMX_USER:JMX_PASSWORD localhost:8849 
org.archive.crawler:host=localhost,jmxport=8849,mother=h1203120532639,name=194-20080216000911438,type=CrawlService.Job 
getDatabaseStats=false,true,allqueues
02/19/2008 23:15:07 +0000 org.archive.jmx.Client 
getDatabaseStats=false,true,allqueues: numLeafNodes=0
numDeletedLeafNodes=0
numDuplicateCountLeafNodes=0
mainTreeMaxDepth=0
duplicateTreeMaxDepth=0

Noah


r.laing wrote:
> has someone more detailed examples using jmxclient?
> i'm using jconsole to explore available 'operations',
> but i'd prefere a more intuitive way to use from shell.
> 
> to simplify i'm thinking a bash wrapper, or a simple cmd aliasing 
> should be very fine.
> 
> greets
> 
> 
> --
> robert laing
